Text: Roger Ebert ""Tampopo" is one of those utterly original movies that seems to exist in no known category. Like the French comedies of Jacques Tati, it's a bemused meditation on human nature in which one humorous situation flows into another offhandedly, as if life were a series of smiles.Two Thumbs Up!"
From DVD cover, "23 TOP TEN FILM OF THE YEAR LIST during its release year including The New York Times, Time Magazine and Los Angeles Times."

"Billed as the "first Japanese noodle western," this comedy offers a satirical view of the relationship between food and sex, one of the director's favorite topics. Watch as a widow running a Tokyo restaurant and a cowboy hat-wearing truck driver try to make the perfect bowl of ramen. Highly acclaimed film from director Itami.", synopsis from rottentomatoes.com. 100%   for Critics Tomatometer.
